definition:
The [*Erdős-Bacon number*]{} of a mathematician or an actor is the sum
of their and their Bacon number. Not many professional mathematicians
have had film rôles. However, a few important ones have done consulting
work for Hollywood films about mathematicians, such as [*A Beautiful
Mind*]{}. For example, William Timothy Gowers, who has Erdős number 4,
was a consultant for [*Proof*]{}, with Gwyneth Paltrow in the lead rôle.
Paltrow was in [*se7en*]{} with Endre Hules, who was in [*Apollo 13*]{}
with Kevin Bacon. Thus Gowers has an Erdős-Bacon number of 7. Daniel
Kleitman, consultant for [*Good Will Hunting*]{}, has an even smaller
Erdős-Bacon number, 3, since he co-authored a paper with Erdős and the
film included Minnie Driver, who starred with Bacon in [*Sleepers*]{}.
The smallest likely Erdős-Bacon number would probably be 2, if an Erdős
co-author consulted for a movie starring Bacon. It’s also possible that
Kevin Bacon could co-author a mathematical paper with an Erdős
co-author, but this appears unlikely.
